New Records: Carlos Rodón tied a Yankees World Series record by allowing three home runs.
Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history in Game 1.
Freddie Freeman has homered in four straight Series games, one shy of the record held by Astros outfielder George Springer.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani partially dislocated his left shoulder on a slide at second base.
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernández hit home runs off Carlos Rodón.
Giancarlo Stanton’s one-out RBI single in the ninth inning.
Alex Vesia retired pinch-hitter Jose Trevino on a first-pitch flyout for his first postseason save.
Mookie Betts singled with two outs and Teoscar Hernández homered into the right-center pavilion.
Post-Match Reflections: Yoshinobu Yamamoto expressed mixed feelings about his performance, being happy but focused.
Aaron Judge commented on his struggles, saying he needs to start swinging at strikes.
Aaron Boone emphasized the need to make the series long and not flinch.
Freddie Freeman discussed managing his sprained right ankle and preparing for Game 3.
Teoscar Hernández reflected on the silence in the stadium after Ohtani's injury, hoping he will be okay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yoshinobu Yamamoto walked back to his dugout and made the slightest tip of his cap to cheering fans.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto turned down the Yankees last December and joined the Dodgers for a $325 million, 12-year contract, a record for pitchers.
Los Angeles took a 2-0 Series lead for the first time since 1988.
The Yankees are 0-2 for the first time since 2001.
